required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Electrical Stimulation for the Treatment of Pain Following Total Knee Arthroplasty (TKA) Using the SPRINT System
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Case Series Study of SPR Peripheral Nerve Stimulation (PNS) Therapy for the Treatment of Pain Following Total Knee Arthroplasty (TKA) Utilizing Preoperative Lead Placement

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if electrical stimulation (small levels of electricity) can safely and effectively reduce pain following total knee replacement. This study involves a device called the SPRINT System. The SPRINT System delivers mild electrical stimulation to nerves in the leg that received the knee replacement. The SPRINT System includes a small wire (called a "lead") that is placed through the skin in the upper leg. It also includes a device worn on the body that delivers stimulation (called the SPRINT Stimulator).

primary_outcome.measure: Mean knee pain while walking as measured by the Brief Pain Inventory during first 4 weeks of treatment compared to historical controls
primary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative Day 0 to 28 (first 4 weeks following TKA)
Duration of hospital stay for TKA, an expected average of 3 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Average knee pain as measured by the Brief Pain Inventory during first 4 weeks of treatment compared to historical controls
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative Day 0 to 28 (first 4 weeks following TKA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Average knee pain at rest as measured by the Brief Pain Inventory during first 4 weeks of treatment compared to historical controls
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative Day 0 to 28 (first 4 weeks following TKA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative analgesic usage as noted by subject in daily diary compared to historical controls
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during lead placement, during TKA surgery, duration of hospital stay for TKA (average 3 days), 1-week post TKA, 2-weeks post-TKA, 3-weeks post-TKA, 4-weeks post-TKA, 5-weeks post-TKA, 6-weeks post-TKA, 2-months post-TKA, 3-months post-TKA

secondary_outcome.measure: Opioid related side effects as measured by side effect checklist compared to historical controls
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during lead placement, duration of hospital stay for TKA (expected average 3 days), 1-week post TKA, 2-weeks post-TKA, 3-weeks post-TKA, 4-weeks post-TKA, 5-weeks post-TKA, 6-weeks post-TKA, 2-months post-TKA, 3-months post-TKA

secondary_outcome.measure: Range of motion as measured by degrees of active and passive knee flexion and extension compared to historical controls
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During lead placement, duration of hospital stay for TKA (expected average 3 days), 2-weeks post-TKA, 6-weeks post-TKA, 3-months post-TKA

secondary_outcome.measure: Timed Up and Go (TUG) Test time compared to historical controls
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, last day of hospital stay for TKA (average of 3 days following TKA), 2-weeks post-TKA, 6-weeks post-TKA, 3-months post-TKA

secondary_outcome.measure: 6 Minute Walk Test distance compared to historical controls
Fixed Distance Walk Test time compared to historical controls
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, last day of hospital stay for TKA (average of 3 days following TKA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Western Ontario McMaster University Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC) score compared to historical controls
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, last day of hospital stay for TKA (average of 3 days following TKA), 2-weeks post-TKA, 6-weeks post-TKA, 3-months post-TKA

secondary_outcome.measure: Knee pain interference with activities of daily living as measured by the Brief Pain Inventory compared to historical controls
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, duration of hospital stay for TKA (expected average of 3 days), 1-week post TKA, 2-weeks post-TKA, 3-weeks post-TKA, 4-weeks post-TKA, 5-weeks post-TKA, 6-weeks post-TKA, 2-months post-TKA, 3-months post-TKA

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression of Change score compared to historical controls
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, last day of hospital stay for TKA (average of 3 days following TKA), 1-week post TKA, 2-weeks post-TKA, 3-weeks post-TKA, 4-weeks post-TKA, 5-weeks post-TKA, 6-weeks post-TKA, 2-months post-TKA, 3-months post-TKA

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Catastrophizing Scale score compared to historical controls
Time to meet recovery milestones compared to historical controls
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of hospital stay for TKA (expected average of 3 days), 1-week post TKA, 2-weeks post-TKA, 3-weeks post-TKA, 4-weeks post-TKA, 5-weeks post-TKA, 6-weeks post-TKA, 2-months post-TKA, 3-months post-TKA

secondary_outcome.measure: Subject satisfaction with the study and therapy as measured by a Subject Satisfaction Survey

arm_group.description: All study subjects will have up to 2 Smartpatch Leads placed in their leg that underwent total knee replacement, will use the SPRINT Peripheral Nerve Stimulation (PNS) System, and will receive electrical stimulation.

intervention.description: The SPRINT System is an Investigational Device which delivers mild electrical stimulation to nerves in the leg that underwent lead placement. The SPRINT System includes a small wire (called a "Lead") that is placed through the skin in the upper leg. It also includes a device worn on the body that delivers stimulation (called the SPRINT Stimulator).

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 21 years old
- Scheduled to undergo a primary unilateral total knee replacement procedure
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Body Mass Index (BMI) > 40 kg/m2
- Compromised immune system based on medical history
- History of valvular heart disease
- Implanted electronic device
- Joint or overlying skin infection of the affected limb
- History of recurrent skin infections
- Bleeding disorder
- Allergy to skin surface electrodes and/or medical‐grade adhesive tapes
- Pregnant
